intro: Hieraciodes pontana, commonly known as the Pontic hawksbeard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieraciodes pontana is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
